alert.note: Alert for Charleston (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 21 at 3:35AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast South Carolina, including the following county, Charleston. * WHEN...Until 545 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 334 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Radar rainfall estimates and automated rain gauges indicate that as much as 3 to 6 inches of rain fell across portions of Sullivan`s Island and Mount Pleasant since midnight. Rainfall has ended and no additional flooding is expected. However, roads that flooding during the most intense rainfall will likely remain flooded for another hour or two. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Mount Pleasant, Isle Of Palms, Sullivan`s Island, Sullivans Island, Mount Pleasant Towne Centre, Seaside Farms, Fort Moultrie, East Cooper Regional Medical Center, The Old Village, Ion, Remleys Point and Hobcaw Point.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Report flooding directly to the Charleston National Weather Service at 1-888-383-2024 or email your reports to nws.charlestonsc@noaa.gov.
